import { Step, Steps } from 'fumadocs-ui/components/steps';
import { Callout } from "fumadocs-ui/components/callout"

In this section, we will add interactivity to your streamed components.

<Steps>


<Step>
Update your `ProductCarousel` component to handle selection.

```tsx title="components/product-carousel.tsx"
"use client"; // [!code highlight]
/**
 * This code was generated by v0 by Vercel.
 * @see https://v0.dev/t/VFdYPYy7iUy
 * Documentation: https://v0.dev/docs#integrating-generated-code-into-your-nextjs-app
 */

import { Card } from "@/components/ui/card";
import {
  CarouselItem,
  CarouselContent,
  CarouselPrevious,
  CarouselNext,
  Carousel,
} from "@/components/ui/carousel";
import { useActions, useUIState } from "ai/rsc"; // [!code highlight]
import { Button } from "./ui/button"; // [!code highlight]
import { ClientMessage } from "@/app/actions"; // [!code highlight]
import { nanoid } from "nanoid"; // [!code highlight]
import { Product } from "@/lib/schemas/products";

export function ProductCarousel({
  products,
}: {
  products?: Product[];
}) {
  const [_, setConversation] = useUIState(); // [!code highlight]
  const { continueConversation } = useActions(); // [!code highlight]
  return (
    <Carousel className="w-full max-w-2xl">
      <CarouselContent>
        {products?.map((p) => (
          <CarouselItem key={p.name}>
            <Card className="flex flex-col items-center gap-4 p-6">
              <div className="text-center">
                <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold">{p.name}</h3>
                <p className="text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">
                  {p.description}
                </p>
                <Button // [!code highlight]
                  className="mt-4" // [!code highlight]
                  variant="outline" // [!code highlight]
                  onClick={async () => { // [!code highlight]
                    console.log("Get product info for ", { product: p }); // [!code highlight]
                    setConversation((currentConversation: ClientMessage[]) => [ // [!code highlight]
                      ...currentConversation, // [!code highlight]
                      { // [!code highlight]
                        id: nanoid(), // [!code highlight]
                        role: "user", // [!code highlight]
                        display: "Get product info for " + p.name, // [!code highlight]
                      }, // [!code highlight]
                    ]);// [!code highlight]

                    const message = await continueConversation(// [!code highlight]
                      "Get product info for " + JSON.stringify({ product: p }),// [!code highlight]
                    );// [!code highlight]

                    setConversation((currentConversation: ClientMessage[]) => [// [!code highlight]
                      ...currentConversation,// [!code highlight]
                      message, // [!code highlight]
                    ]);// [!code highlight]
                  }}// [!code highlight]
                > // [!code highlight]
                  More info// [!code highlight]
                </Button>// [!code highlight]
              </div>
            </Card>
          </CarouselItem>
        ))}
      </CarouselContent>
      <CarouselPrevious />
      <CarouselNext />
    </Carousel>
  );
}
```
<Callout>
Remember to mark it as a client component!
</Callout>
</Step>
<Step>
Let's generate a detailed product card component with v0. We can use this [example](https://v0.dev/r/iVGYR8V8wNH) and add it to your project, with the following command. Call it `ProductCard`.
```bash
npx v0 add NscAFoMGpdh -n ProductCard
```
</Step>
<Step>
Update the component to accept the `product` as a prop.
```tsx title="components/product-card.tsx"
/**
 * This code was generated by v0 by Vercel.
 * @see https://v0.dev/t/NscAFoMGpdh
 * Documentation: https://v0.dev/docs#integrating-generated-code-into-your-nextjs-app
 */
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button";
import { Product } from "@/lib/schemas/products"; // [!code highlight]

export function ProductCard({
  product,// [!code highlight]
}: {// [!code highlight]
  product: Product;// [!code highlight]
}) {
  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-start gap-6 bg-white p-8 shadow-lg rounded-lg dark:bg-gray-950">
      <div className="space-y-2">
        <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold tracking-tight">{product.name}</h2>// [!code highlight]
        <p className="text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">
          {product.description}// [!code highlight]
        </p>
      </div>
      <div className="flex items-baseline gap-2">
        <span className="text-4xl font-bold">${product.price}</span>// [!code highlight]
        {product.type === "subscription" ? (// [!code highlight]
          <span className="text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400 text-sm">// [!code highlight]
            /month// [!code highlight]
          </span>// [!code highlight]
        ) : null}// [!code highlight]
      </div>
      <Button className="w-full">
        {product.type === "subscription" ? "Subscribe" : "Buy"} Now// [!code highlight]
      </Button>
    </div>
  );
}
```
</Step>


<Step>
Add a new tool to handle getting a specific product.

```typescript title="app/actions.tsx"
// REST OF CODE
    tools: {
      // your other tool
      getSpecificProduct: {
        description:
          "Select specific products. Use this if the user asks for more info on a product.",
        parameters: productSchema,
        generate: async function (product) {
          history.done((messages: ServerMessage[]) => [
            ...messages,
            {
              role: "assistant",
              content: "Selecting specific product:" + product.name,
            },
          ]);

          return (
            <ProductCard product={product} />
          );
        },
      }
    }
// REST OF CODE
```

</Step>
</Steps>
